page.title: 11Wymondham College cont.
page.content: Wymondham College is unusual, being a large boarding school run by a Local Education Authority. For many years it was a grammar school, taking pupils from regions of Norfolk which were not close to other grammar schools. At one point it had large numbers of day pupils and reached nearly 1900. Following reorganisation in the County, the College became comprehensive in its intake, catering largely for pupils with boarding need. There are now (1985) no day pupils in the 1st to 5th years, but a very large number of day pupils in the 6th form. Total numbers are now about 900, nearly half in the sixth form. The College has a reputation for good results and has been involved in many innovative programs. SC21CS
